text: James Frith (1860-1946), was an English bowls player who competed in the 1930 British Empire Games. ==Bowls career== At the 1930 British Empire Games he won the gold medal in the rinks (fours) event with Ernie Gudgeon, Albert Hough and James Edney. He was a 1921 rinks (fours) National Champion bowling for the Belgrave Bowls Club, Northumberland. ==Personal Life== He was an Life Assurance agent by trade and lived in Newcastle upon Tyne. ==References== Category:English male bowls players Category:Bowls players at the 1930 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for England Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in lawn bowls Category:1860 births Category:1946 deaths
title: James Frith (bowls)
